meanings.definition: To remove or drain a substance from something
meanings.sent1: The paper towel leaches the excess water from the spilled drink.
meanings.sent2: The soil leaches nutrients from the plants to help them grow.
meanings.sent3: The sponge leaches up the spilled juice like a thirsty desert traveler.
meanings.sent4: The old building leaches memories of the past into the minds of those who visit.
meanings.sent5: The tree roots leach moisture from the ground to sustain the tree during dry seasons.

meanings.definition: A person who extracts money or resources from others
meanings.sent1: The leaches in the company always find ways to take advantage of their coworkers.
meanings.sent2: Beware of financial leaches who try to exploit your hard-earned savings.
meanings.sent3: The leaches at the party always manage to get free drinks without contributing.
meanings.sent4: The leaches in society prey on the generosity of kind-hearted individuals.
meanings.sent5: The leaches in the community drain resources without giving anything back.

meanings.definition: A type of worm that lives in water and feeds on blood
meanings.sent1: The leaches in the pond attach themselves to fish to feed on their blood.
meanings.sent2: Swimmers should be cautious of leaches in freshwater lakes.
meanings.sent3: The leaches in the river have a blood-sucking party whenever they find a host.
meanings.sent4: The leaches in the stream are like tiny vampires lurking in the water.
meanings.sent5: The leaches in the lake cling to unsuspecting swimmers for a blood meal.
